title: Improve error message when package name is not consistent with Spack's conventions
body:
Trying to install a new own package in local (probably wrong created by myself) I got this trace error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/my/path/spack/bin/spack", line 220, in <module>
    main(sys.argv)
  File "/my/path/spack/bin/spack", line 216, in main
    _main(args, unknown)
  File "/my/path/spack/bin/spack", line 183, in _main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/install.py", line 317, in install
    specs = spack.cmd.parse_specs(args.package, concretize=True)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/__init__.py", line 116, in parse_specs
    spec.concretize()  # implies normalize
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1681, in concretize
    self._expand_virtual_packages(),
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1598, in _expand_virtual_packages
    spec)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 113, in choose_virtual_or_external
    candidates = self._valid_virtuals_and_externals(spec)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 87, in _valid_virtuals_and_externals
    if is_spec_buildable(cspec):
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/package_prefs.py", line 239, in is_spec_buildable
    allpkgs = get_packages_config()
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/package_prefs.py", line 53, in get_packages_config
    if spack.repo.is_virtual(pkg_name)]
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 347, in is_virtual
    return pkg_name in self.provider_index
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 233, in provider_index
    self._provider_index.merge(repo.provider_index)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 652, in provider_index
    self._update_provider_index()
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/repository.py", line 646, in _update_provider_index
    self._provider_index.to_yaml(new)
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/llnl/util/lock.py", line 312, in __exit__
    if self._as.__exit__(type, value, traceback):
  File "/mnt/my/path/spack/lib/spack/spack/file_cache.py", line 152, in __exit__
    raise value
TypeError: exceptions must be old-style classes or derived from BaseException, not str
```

The last error comes from [here](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/spack/file_cache.py#L152). The trace suggests that `value` does not derive from an Exception class. Any idea what is happening?
